name: Sixty Second Science
description:
This game was designed for Catalyst Hack April 2019.

The idea behind this hackathon was to create a piece of software that would encourage young women/non binary folks to consider taking STEM subjects at A-Level and therefore setting them up to go into STEM fields. 

Inspired by the fast paced gameplay of WarioWare and Q Dork we created the idea of a game with very quick levels that would represent different fields in STEM and each level you pass would unlock quotes from women/non binary people from the past and present of STEM that players could access in a different part of the game and find out more about the individuals. 

I came up with a marketing strategy for us that would be spread on social media using the hashtag #PlayInspireCreate to increase visibility of the game and also inspire the young people playing the game to design their own levels and submit them into a competition to be featured in game.
